metadata.Title: CVE-2022-31744 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An attacker could have injected CSS into stylesheets accessible via internal URIs, such as resource:, and in doing so bypass a page's Content Security Policy. This vulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 91.11, Thunderbird < 102, Thunderbird < 91.11, and Firefox < 101.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-31744` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

thunderbird - 1:91.11.0+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:91.11.0+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:91.11.0+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:91.11.0+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:91.11.0+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:91.11.0+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine mdeslaur> starting with Ubuntu 22.04, the firefox package is just a script that installs the Firefox snap

criterions.comment: mozjs78 package in kinetic is affected and may need fixing.
thunderbird package in kinetic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:91.11.0+build1-0ubuntu1').
